blackdoor.struct

Class ByteQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.struct.ByteQueue

  • public class ByteQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    nfischer3 A FIFO queue data structure for bytes implemented with a circular array. The java.nio.ByteBuffer class offers slightly faster performance, but greatly increased difficulty of use if you want to remove elements between writes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteQueue()
      Create new non-resizable ByteQueue with default size of 99 bytes.
      ByteQueue(int size)
      Create new non-resizable ByteQueue with size bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main()

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        check if the Queue is full
        Returns:
        true if the Queue would resize or throw a buffer overflow at the next enQueue call

      • resize

        public void resize(int newSize)
        Grow or shrink the queue to newSize bytes. If newSize < filled() an underflow exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        newSize -

      • trim

        public void trim()
        Shrink the queue so that capacity() == filled()

      • enQueue

        public void enQueue(byte[] src)
        Add an array of bytes into the queue. Equivalent to calling enQueue(src, 0, src.length)
        Parameters:
        src - - the array of bytes to add to the queue

      • enQueue

        public void enQueue(byte[] src,
                    int offset,
                    int length)
        Add a part of an array of bytes into the queue.
        Parameters:
        src - - the source array of bytes to add to the queue.
        offset - - the start index of src from which bytes should be enqueued.
        length - - the number of bytes from offset in src that should be enqueued.

      • deQueue

        public byte[] deQueue(int length)
        Remove and return length bytes from the queue.
        Parameters:
        length - - the number of bytes to remove from the queue.
        Returns:
        the first length bytes that were entered into the queue.

      • deQueue

        public void deQueue(byte[] dest,
                    int offset,
                    int length)
        Remove length bytes from the queue and put them into an array.
        Parameters:
        dest - - the destination array to put the bytes in.
        offset - - the start index of dest to which bytes should be dequeued.
        length - - the number of bytes from offset in dest that bytes will be copied into.

      • filled

        public int filled()
        Returns:
        the number of bytes in the queue.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Returns:
        the number of elements that can be stored in this buffer

      • isResizable

        public boolean isResizable()
        Returns:
        true if the queue will grow instead of throwing BufferOverflowException on enQueue.

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
        change whether the queue will grow instead of throwing BufferOverflowException on enQueue.
        Parameters:
        resizable - - set to true for growing instead of throwing.

      • details

        public java.lang.String details()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
